headline: Awesome Broccoli-Cheese Casserole
description: This tasty broccoli cheese casserole will turn even the pickiest of eaters into broccoli fans! Pairs well with Thanksgiving turkey or Christmas ham.

video.description: See how to make a classic, creamy and cheesy broccoli casserole.
video.name: Awesome Broccoli Cheese Casserole

name: Awesome Broccoli-Cheese Casserole
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Whisk condensed soup, mayonnaise, egg, and onions together in a medium mixing bowl until combined.

Place frozen broccoli into a very large mixing bowl and break it up if necessary; add soup mixture and mix well to coat. Sprinkle with cheese and mix well; spread mixture into the prepared baking dish. Season with salt, pepper, and paprika.
Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: Easy and good!...Will make it again!

I made this recipe just as it was and it came out to be absolutely delicious. I made fried chicken as my main meal and this was my side dish that everyone was raving about. Thank you for this wonderful addition to my nightly dinner menu. Shara Hansen
Broccoli was way to hard for my taste.

This turned out perfect. I did make a couple changes. I added half a block of cream cheese softened as well as instead of a full cup of mayo, I used 1/2 cup mayo and 1/2 cup sour cream. You can add crushed crackers on top for a crust if wanted. I personally used plain cornflakes crushed on top just because I did not have crackers on hand. That was my preference. But, I had made this recipe before step by step and it's great. My husband loves this and wants it at weeknight dinners. Thanks so much for sharing this recipe.
I use this recipe every year and my family loves it however I don't use eggs and o mox crushed cheese it crackers in the mix and sprinkle on top as well

I made this on a -40° winter evening and my wife absolutely loved it saying "it tastes like a warm delicious hug". Only having one head of broccoli, I made a few tweaks to turn into a full one dish meal. Modifications: - 30oz of mixed vegetables (head of broccoli[crowned], one bell pepper[pieces], one large carrot[sliced], 6 small mushrooms[into sixths]) - Half cup mayo, half cup sour cream (thanks everyone) - Sautéed the onions with ~5 cloves of garlic and 4 diced boneless chicken thighs I know I diverged a bit from the recipe, but I think this recipe is great as a base and will 100% be making using it again.
I didn't like this much at all. It was bland and had a weird texture. I also think it was a waste of broccoli and cheese.
easy to make and very tasty

I made it mostly as written, but made three changes: 1) used fresh broccoli instead of frozen; 2) subbed in 1/2 cup sour cream for 1/2 cup of the mayo; 3) doubled the amount of onions used, added some shallots as well, and fresh minced garlic, all of which I browned in butter before adding to the mixture. Overall it turned out very well, and was a hit at the Thanksgiving dinner where I served it. I would note that I was fairly generous with the "salt and pepper to taste," and I wonder if those who complain that the recipe is "bland" just didn't season it enough. When I make it again, I'm going to try some other variations, including: using cream of broccoli soup instead of mushroom; adding some additional herbs to the mixture, like thyme or oregano; adding a few splashes of sherry to the liquid.
Next time I will use frozen broccoli pieces not the frozen broccoli florets.
Quick and fun recipe. I added chopped bacon the second time and OMG! So good. I crush cheese it crackers on the top and everyone loved it!

I've never made a casserole before (I'm in my 20's & live in Southern California where people don't really eat them) but this is BY FAR the easiest most fool proof dish I've ever made! Like many of the other reviewers, I followed everyone's advice of doing 1/2 mayo and 1/2 sour cream and I think that really is the way to go because it gives it more of a tanginess. I also used "cream of mushroom with roasted garlic" soup and would have probably added garlic powder if I hadn't done that. If you want it to be pretty cheesy, definitely add more cheese (maybe 4-8 oz more). I did this as a side dish for Thanksgiving where we already had creamy mashed potatoes, mac & cheese, and stuffing, so this dish was supposed to be our "vegetable" so I kind of liked that it turned out to be not overly cheesy/creamy and was heavy on the broccoli. My oven sucks but it baked evenly. However, it needed closer to 1hr and 20 minutes to be fully hot in the middle. I actually ended up forgetting to add salt and it was totally fine without it (and that's saying a lot because I usually put extra salt in things!). I chose to top this with French's crispy fried onions and it worked perfectly. Everyone loved it so I wrote it into my recipe book to make again in the future!
Great recipe! For personal preference added red pepper, French fried onions, butter and crackers to the mixture and sprinkled crackers on top. Used American, cheddar and velveeta cheese.
I made it correctly. I brought it to Thanksgiving dinner. It was meh. No one liked it. A waste of broccoli and cheese honestly.

I made this recipe as directed and thought it was great. I usually make a recipe as directed and then adjust to my taste. Only thing I'd do different is add more cheese, but I like a lot of cheese. It kills me on some of the reviews that give one star and they say how they made it. How can you rate a recipe one star if you totally change up all the ingredients so it's like a totally different recipe? Rate it by the way it is written and then make suggestions on the way you like it. I'd give it 5 stars. I like it better than any broccoli cheese casserole I've ever made.
My family and I love this recipe and make it through out the year, Enjoy!!
it was really good
I make this for every Thanksgiving. It's my go-to broccoli recipe.
Super awesome e Ben better with 1/2 cup crispy Bacon Bits!👍
I really loved this recipe. For more protein I added a grilled chicken breast. Next time I will add 2. I also added dried rosemary and garlic powder. Loved it!
This dish is my new favorite! Yummy and easy to make

I've made this three times already in the past month! I make the dish and then have some for lunch or dinner all week. It never disappoints! I accidentally bought golden mushroom rather than cream of mushroom and it had so much flavor to it-so next time you make this try it with the golden mushroom soup. But either way it tastes great!
Always a hit. I use 2 eggs to keep it moist.
Great Family loves it. I used Onion seasoning for flavor since some of my family will not eat onions

This recipe was enjoyed by my family. I cooked the 2 bags of broccoli florets In chicken broth, drained, and cooled. Then mixed 1 cup of mayonnaise, 1 cup of sour cream, 2 cans of cream of mushroom soup, 2 eggs, 3 cups of shredded sharp cheese. Season to taste with salt, pepper, smoked paprika, minced onions. Baked @ 350 for 1 hour. Let it cool for at least 30 minutes.
Great side! Thanks!!

I bought some broccoli on a good sale and figured I'd make cream of broccoli soup. But when I found this recipe I had to try it. Like many others mentioned, I did 1/2 cup mayo and 1/2 cup sour cream and increased the cheese by another half cup. I chose to put tater tots on top. At the last 3 minutes I took it out of the oven, sprinkled some of the shredded cheese and broiled for the remaining time. We all scarfed it. It will be a new staple for us and I'm excited to share it at family functions and pot lucks.

The recipe was perfect, my family love it! My second time making it, I added a cauliflower and cut carrots blend to replace the third bag of broccoli that the recipe calls for. It turned out to be just as delicious as the original recipe!

2 eggs beaten, 1 cup melted margarine, 1 cup HELLMAN's (not miracle whip) mayonnaise, 1 can cream of mushroom soup, 1 1/2 cups grated sharp cheddar cheese, 2 Tbsp chopped onion, 2 pkgs. frozen chopped broccoli, 1 small bag pepperidge farm stuffing mix. Cook & drain broccoli, mix everything else together (except stuffing mix), pour into greased casserole and top w/stuffing mix. Bake 350 for one hour.

I was left with a corner of casserole that I had to defend to take home lol. It was a huge hit and so flavorful. I forgot the salt, pepper and paprika but it was plentiful and tasty withoiut

You have to chop it and cook it of course and she really liked it because it is very hard to overcook or ruin this recipe, just have fun with it.👍

My family loves it. Only thing I do differently is i add cheese in step 2 and mix it all together. And I had more cheese on the top after I spread the mixture in a pan. Then I bake it for 1 hour exactly.

I doubled the cream of mushroom soup, added another bag of broccoli and a can of shredded chicken. Also sprinkled some turmeric on top with the pepper and paprika. It was a hit at the church potluck, and disappeared before I got a picture!!
